subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Anti-patterns
msgSnippet: ... No problemo!  Hopefully we ll be able to put together some appropriate checks for JUnit 4 annotation-based tests... should be doable since the latest
messageBody:
On Tue, 2006-02-21 at 22:11 +0000, Andrew McDonagh wrote:
> >Last PMD plug :-) - it catches this case too:
> >
> >http://pmd.sourceforge.net/rules/junit.html#UseAssertEqualsInsteadOfAsse
> >rtTrue
> >
> cool!
>
> I haven't been keeping up to date with PMD... so thanks for the heads up!

No problemo! Hopefully we'll be able to put together some appropriate
checks for JUnit 4 annotation-based tests... should be doable since the
latest JavaCC grammar parses out annotations into a nice abstract syntax
tree. Onwards and upwards!

Yours,

Tom
